intro: Aglaia littoralis, commonly known as the coastal aglaia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Aglaia littoralis is often found growing near coastal areas and in moist, tropical environments.
